website_summaries.verdict: A well-loved and well-made dog paw cleaner that's as popular with pups as it is with pet parents.
pros: Soft silicone bristles gently and effectively clean paws without causing discomfort
Available in 3 sizes and multiple colors
cons: A bit pricier than some others

customer_reviews.title: Good product -> TIP for dog lovers
customer_reviews.text: I use this cleaner after long walks with my dogs, as they love to get dirty. It’s easy to use and does the job well. When the paws dry up I put Paw Shield by Petsupply on them. This paw balm heals and moisturizes dry, creacked paw pads. It also does a very good job when it comes to paw protection. It’s perfect way to take care of you dog’s paws during the winter. Here is the link to Paw Shield:
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: The large size, is bigger than a water bottle and seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but wanted to posted photos to help people see the size of the large cup and the information from it if needed. I think it's more helpful then just dogs photos. I'll update after next mud adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Mlspirit

customer_reviews.title: If you have a small dog, this is simply not for you.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this considering my dog seems to search out anything wet/muddy. I have a Pom so I got the small size. Well I could fit my dogs entire head inside this thing, it is far too big. It was also incredibly awkward trying to use and ended up just making a big mess. And NO, my dogs paws were not clean afterward. I will try a few more times to confrim it’s uselessness.
customer_reviews.author: Prime so

customer_reviews.title: WAY TOO SMALL for my golden doodle (even large size)
customer_reviews.text: this is way way too small for my golden doodle - plus you need a bucket with you to keep refilling the supersize drink size cup...I was so hopeful and loved the idea of those rubber tips vs. the brushes of the Paws plunger (which are too soft)...will likely return it...
customer_reviews.author: hikeryaker

customer_reviews.title: Was actually worse than doing nothing
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work. Water gets muddy after one foot is dipped. And foot is left very wet. Was actually worse than doing nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Book

customer_reviews.title: BEST MONEY SPENT
customer_reviews.text: I have Been looking for a paw washer as our great dane has very bad allergies. After countless hours looking and reviewing I went with this. I could not be more pleased It fits our 133lbs great danes paw with room left over. The quality it's great not cheap or flimsy and love the pink color. This is a MUST for dog paws
customer_reviews.author: P&k

customer_reviews.title: Product works as described. Check out the size chart in the description.
customer_reviews.text: This product measures true to size. I have a black lab mix and I got the large blue paw cleaner. I didn’t notice the size chart listed in the description. I probably could have gotten away with the medium, but it is nice that the large cleans a little higher on her feet. Overall, the product works as shown. It is easy to clean and use. It isn’t quite as portable as I wanted because of the size, but once we pack all of her toys up to play adding this doesn’t seem to make a big difference. It’s great to use before coming in the house or getting in the truck cab on a rainy day.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac F.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Recommending it to all my dog lovers. I have a pitbull and ordered a large. Wish I would have ordered the medium but still works out well. He HATES his paws messed with but he tolerated me cleaning them with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, even though it looks like an Alien Fleshlight.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. The key is how comfortable your dogs are with you sticking their paws into this contraption. We have 2 small dogs - one doesn't mind the task of cleaning, and the other is not a fan of this. But the contraption itself works really well. Just try to avoid the urge to stick your junk inside of it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Does not work to clean my dogs paws
customer_reviews.text: Omg....this just made a wet muddy mess instead of just dirt on the paws. Much easier to use a towel and wipe the paws off. This did not squeegee the mud off their paws, just made it wet. My mwhole d room became a muddy wet mess. Usually I use a rag to wipe their feet. Thought this would work better and more conveniently. Nope. This made a huge mess.
customer_reviews.author: Critique god

customer_reviews.title: Disaster for a new mom
customer_reviews.text: In our case, the water turns black easily after each paw. Our Pomeranian likes to mark his territory by kicking back dirt along the yard. Well, doing this to each paw would require changing the water each time, and keeping the dog still in order to dry and get all of the mud off each paw. I just do not have time for this with an infant at home.
customer_reviews.author: alexis Sofia

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not realistic. This product is more work than just wiping off the dog paws. You first have to fill it up, stick each paw in and thoroughly shake then wash this out. Easier to just use baby wipes.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: ... hassle to use this than to just use a good cloth to wipe down my dogs
customer_reviews.text: Ended up being more of a hassle to use this than to just use a good cloth to wipe down my dogs feet
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: Goldendoodle Pup Review
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so delivered today and ironically the puppy got dirty today too!! We used this for the first time—-if you have a dog with short hair, I imagine that it would be amazing. We have a 5 month old Goldendoodle, and I had to change the water for each foot and then repeat the process at least 3 times on each paw. It did get up the back of her paws which I struggle to be able to do with the bowl that I used previously to rinse her paws. All in all, it is a good product and works, it just takes a bit more effort and process for a dog with longer hair.
customer_reviews.author: Fisher Bunch

customer_reviews.title: More of a pain than just getting a bucket of water if you have large dog.
customer_reviews.text: Wash one paw and water is too dirty to keep using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't clean paws.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work at all. The dog's paws were just as dirty and now they're wet and dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Bilodeau

customer_reviews.title: Easily disassemblable for
customer_reviews.text: Mostly just gets paws wet...does not effectively get ANY dirt or mud off. Easily disassemblable for cleaning
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, works great and easy to clean/use
customer_reviews.text: I would give it more stars if I could! My beagle mix is constantly digging and we were looking for a way to clean her paws so she wasn’t tracking mud over our carpets. This is amazing and simple plus it’s easy to clean. She doesn’t mind it so much it’s better than the Tupperware we’ve been dipping her paws in before. The little fingers get in between her pads and a little vigorous dip and rotate we were amazed how well it worked. We got the medium and she’s a puggle weighing 26lb.
customer_reviews.author: Not today

customer_reviews.title: Not quite like advertised.
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs - small, medium, large. They love to be outside in our backyard and run along the fence playing with our neighbors dogs. That area gets very muddy after a rain. I bought 3 cups in 2 different sizes. These do not hold enough water to really clean muddy paws. Even taking extra water outside with me it didn't help. After changing the water 3 times, they were still not mud free. And trying to get them to stand still and lift one leg at a time was not easy. This is not the answer to muddy dog paws.
customer_reviews.author: babs

customer_reviews.title: Makes life a little bit easier...
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to spend so much money on a plastic cup, but I am glad I did! Got the large size for a wolfhound and the cup is really big (perfect size) and good quality. Gets my dog's paws clean much faster and better without any of the frustration we were experiencing before. Both me and my dog are happier now that we don't have to wrestle with the old wet towel method (which always ended up with us mad at each other). Simple and quick!
customer_reviews.author: KC Shocker

customer_reviews.title: A great way to quickly wash dirt off paws.
customer_reviews.text: It cleans off redwood duff, fine sandy soil, sand/salt from winter roads. The dry off towel stays cleaner, and we're quicker in the door. My regret was that a medium is just a little too small for my 65 lb German Shepherd. Her high claw would occasionally get caught, which would make her wince each time I brought this out. I've since replaced with a large, and she's gotten over her aversion to paw washing. (I gave the medium to a Belgium Malinois, smaller paws.)
customer_reviews.author: atf

customer_reviews.title: Great product, check the size before you buy though.
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Does a great job of cleaning those dirty paws before we let them in the house. One note on sizing, the Medium is perfect for our 80lb labs mixes. We originally bought the large assuming the size based on most dog things, but we were quite wrong. So much so that the product didn’t really work. With the large size, the gap down the middle was so large that the rubber cleaning spikes didn’t really make contact with their paws to get the dirt off when spinning it. The medium size is perfect and gets into all the books in their pads to get the dirt out.
customer_reviews.author: Robert DeNuto

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Buy one. Or 3
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! We moved to the county a few years ago... where it’s dirty. All the freaking time. Gravel is my nemesis. Anyway, this thing works. I have a very fluffy, 20 pound cavapoo. The medium size works great! He doesn’t mind it at all, and in the morning when the grass is wet making everything else stick to his paws, this cleans them up nicely! I really wish I would have found this years ago! (Side note, when you’re cleaning it out, the silicone brush will not go in upside down. Just turn it around instead of getting frustrated like me 🤦🏻‍♀️)
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Not practical in my experience
customer_reviews.text: I really honestly wanted to love this. My husband took one look and said to send it back because it was not going to work any better thank a small pail and a wash cloth. I didn’t listen... I’m regretting that choice now. The quality of material seems fine, but it’s tedious to use frequently and has spilled in the process of using it on my dogs several times. I guess it good for occasional uses (camping and having dogs sleep in your tent or RV maybe when you want to clean their paws 🐾 maybe), but daily use doesn’t seem practical. Waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: MingSu

customer_reviews.title: Sort of works, but not really
customer_reviews.text: For "everyday" paw cleaning (e.g., after walks around the neighborhood), this product is vastly inferior to a simple wet paper towel. A quick wipe-down with a wet paper towel gets my pup's paws clean, whereas using this after a walk still leaves my pup leaving little dirt paw prints on hard flooring. So what is this product good for? It's great as an "initial clean" for extremely muddy paws. It does a great job of removing big globs of mud that would be gross to tackle with a paper towel. But after that "rough" clean, you still gotta go back and wipe down with a wet paper towel to finish the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this to be life changing, but it didn’t life up to the hype. In theory, it looks and sounds like a good design and is easy to clean. I use this with my 90 lbs sheepadoodle and after using it the first time it left my dogs feet sopping wet and only not much cleaner. It did an ok job of removing dirt, but his feet were maybe 50% cleaner after use. Honestly putting him in the bath and rinsing his feet will probably have better outcomes. I was really hoping this would be my answer to muddy paws after the dog park, but didn’t meet my expectation unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Keslie10

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 25 lb puppy, the small is the perfect size for her. I also got the large for my 60 lb dog. Cleans paws very well, and it's easy to clean out afterwards, I like how it all comes apart. Practice a couple times with your dog first. I fill them half way up with warm water. Paws are really wet afterwards so have paper towels or towel handy to dry. They are a lot bigger than I expected but they need to be to do their job. Have patience and treats ready if you have a squirmy pup.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with foot problems
customer_reviews.text: This works great!! My dog has allergies, and digs at her feet all summer. I have spent a fortune on trips to the vet after she chews her feet to the point of open wounds. I just keep this by the door, with a towel, and every time she comes in from outside, I swish each foot, and dry it off. She doesnt like her feet handled, but she doesnt fuss about this at all!! It is amazing how much dirt comes off!! Plus it saves my carpets from dirty dog paws. Then I just dump it out, fill with fresh water, and set it back by the door.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: Clean paws
customer_reviews.text: Omg, best thing we bought for cleaning our pup! We used to wipe her paws every time she comes inside with a puppy wet wipe but that got so expensive, and we saw this. At first our pup did not like it, but she’s getting used to it. Her paws are so clean afterwards! No more dirt and wasting wet wipes. The Silicone brissle is good for getting the dirt out. Twist it around and dip it. Only negative is the small cost more than a medium (how is that even possible?!) we initially bought a medium, turned out too big and returned it and got a small. Works great for our 20lb maltipoo.
customer_reviews.author: H. Koyama

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest invention for pets, EVER.
customer_reviews.text: I have been washing my dogs paws in a basin. She pulls at me and splashes dirty water everywhere. When I saw this, I was curious, so I ordered it. Best decision ever. You fill it with water, put the paw in, swish it around, and dry off the CLEAN paw. When she is really muddy, I have to use new water for each paw to get them clean, but it's way better than the messy basin. LOVE this thing, especially in muddy March weather!
customer_reviews.author: Deen

customer_reviews.title: This thing in theory is a great product but I regretted purchasing it
customer_reviews.text: This thing in theory is a great product but I regretted purchasing it. First off, the water will spill out easily if you tip it slightly for the back legs. I have to do it three times to clean one paw. While changing the water, my dog would walk all over in the dirty wet paws making it even messier. Save yourself some money and don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: SimonAndSally

customer_reviews.title: Not a great tool for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: A great idea, but not really useful for small dogs. Even the smallest cup overwhelms their paws. I also would have liked a lid because we bumped it several times and sent the water everywhere. I think for medium to large dogs it would be decent, but just not a useful tool for us.
customer_reviews.author: Eman

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Clean Paws At All
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my small morkie. It does not clean paws -- you're better off using a cloth and towel. I used this with just water, and then I used it with some of her shampoo mixed in with the water. Got nice and sudsy inside, but it still did nothing. Just wet & dirty paws! The silicone is very soft inside, so it didn't bother her at all. But it just didn't clean at all either. It was quicker to just use her wash cloth to clean her paws and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: This item makes washing my dog's paws much easier. I was using an empty coleslaw container, but this portable washer is much easier to use with my 70lb smooth Collie-mix. I add a drop or two of dawn dishwashing liquid, dip her paw a few times, then gently squeeze as I remove the paw from the container, and dry thoroughly with a cloth or paper towels. I put a tray underneath as it is easy to drip water even when one is careful. It has made it so much easier to clean Chloe's paws after a walk, and she seems to like the massage of the gentle, silicone fingers. Simple device, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dolls by Dotti

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Works well and easily. Fussy dog does not mind.
customer_reviews.text: We live in a rental, and the backyard has major mud problems. Tired of having to do a big clean of my dogs paws every time she went out, decided to give this thing a try. Concept is super easy, fill with water dip dogs paws in and out and rotate around to scrub. It's so simple, and easy and it works so well. Cleaned all four of her paws without fuss! Which is a biggie for us, as our girl hates having her paws cleaned. Am already recommend to my friend doggy owners, and am going to get another. For the car.
customer_reviews.author: CatherineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great For my Doggie!
customer_reviews.text: Everytime I take my doggies for a walk, their paws get so dirty! It is such a hassle to put them in the sink to wash their paws everytime we go out. I have tried a hose, on low, but they don't like it. Then I discovered these. I purchased this size for my 25lb cocker mix. I lay a microfiber dog towel on the floor and fill this with water and a few drops of dog shampoo. I place their paw inside, one at a time, and their paws are clean. The towel gives the wet paw a place to dry off, then when all paws are clean, I dry them with the towel. Perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: kelleysdiy

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I really tried to like this thing. I have a 1 year old black lab pup who LOVES to run in the mud. Makes me CRAZY! I thought this would be perfect! Sadly, it wasn't. Trying to hold him still to stick his paw into it is the first problem, after a sweaty battle of wills, I did finally win, but it was to no avail. It barely took anything off his paws and all I got for my efforts was a muddy self and an irritated puppy. I'd have to say don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: QueenEvil

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product !
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a huge bowl of soapy water and a rag. My dog is well trained and knows to wait at the door until he is told he can go but it hurts my back to maneuver all that stuff. This is great! I used it yesterday and I was pleased. Even though I was in a huge rush it did a great job. You have to towel dry their feet still but that’s expected. Great purchase and my back thanks this company!
customer_reviews.author: Welch

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 large dogs and scarce grass near the back door of my house, so I was hoping this paw cleaner would be my salvation and ensure fewer muddy paw prints inside the house. I was sorely disappointed to find that instead of helping, this product actually makes it worse. If you don’t get every bit of mud off, the dogs then track it everywhere because their feet are now wet. I literally only used it a handful of times before going back to the old-school solution of using a towel.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Essential!
customer_reviews.text: Living in the city, this product is an essential part of our hygiene routine. At least once a day, and always after long walks, we toss a licky mat on the door and wash our Great Dane puppy's paws. Our carpets still look fantastic and it greatly reduces the smell of paw sweat that we don't want to be tracked through the house. The only reason I gave this product a 4-star rating and not a 5-star rating is because the rim doesn't screw on firmly. It's a bummer bc I often reach to pick it up by the top and it pulls right off.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie G.

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer for Muddy Paws
customer_reviews.text: The MudBuster Portable Dog Paw Cleaner has truly been a game changer for our household. We have some lawn areas with drainage issues and it is impossible to keep our Chocolate Lab from getting muddy after heavy rains. Prior to purchasing this product, cleaning her paws 6 times per day with rags and a bucket of water was a major inconvenience. Clean up is now super simple, and our dog seems to enjoy it. Simply fill with water, insert paw and spin. The mud/dirt comes right off. The cleaning 'ribs' are super soft but effective. Cleaning the product itself couldn't be easier, dump it out in the sink and rinse. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C

customer_reviews.title: Shows you how dirty your pup's paws are!
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I was giving my dog a bath, I always noticed how dirty the soap and water was running off of her paws. We take daily walks, go to the beach and hiking on the weekends, so she is in a bunch of dirt. I decided I should be cleaning her paws a bit more to keep my apartment tidier. When I first used this I couldn't BELIEVE how dirty the water was! It really scrubs between their toes. It is really easy to take apart and clean after washing their paws in it, and it literally takes a matter of seconds! I love this device, I use it every week now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for muddy paws!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Siberian Husky and a German Shepherd and an incredibly muddy back yard in the midst of mud season. They were always tracking the mud through the house no matter how many towels I went through trying to clean their paws. These are incredibly easy to use, just add water (I fill it about half full) and place your dogs paws in one at a time! The dirt and mud came right off and I only had to wipe the water from their paws. I ordered the larges for my boys and they work perfectly (one is 65 pounds and one is 90)
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Build a simple process!
customer_reviews.text: I have a VERY active 3 year old 35 lb adventure mutt. Between hiking and tearing up the backyard, his paws are filthy all the time. I have learned that having this washer nearby with a water source, a tiny bit of dog shampoo, a pitcher of fresh water, and a dog towel on hand for rinsing allows for the best most effective and easiest process for washing, rinsing, then wiping paws of for allowing him back inside. It sounds like a lot of work, but once you are used to it (and so is your dog) it's pretty quick and well worth it for keeping carpets, furniture, and anything else dirt free, while having a happy active pup!
customer_reviews.author: joel fleet

customer_reviews.title: Saved me re-homing fees (totally kidding)
customer_reviews.text: Mind blowing! A friend recommended getting something like this so based off of the positive reviews I purchased this in a large. We have 60-70lb golden retrievers and the winter season with our yard is brutal (aka super muddy and I have a brand new couch). At first it was a little awkward to maneuver and the dogs were freaked but eventually I got a good wash and dry routine down. This makes such a difference in what you can do with a wet rag vs this. I definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jenette Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Cleans messy paws fast
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing gadget, sure beats dipping your dogs paws into a bucket of water after a sloppy walk. Extremely easy to use. Fill with about 1/2 to 3/4 of the way with warm water, dip dogs paws individually into it and gently twist or move paws up and down for a few seconds, remove paws, dry off and you're good to go. I recommended it to a neighbor who has a longer haired dog, she loves all for the same reasonsand. Excellent device, every dog owner should own one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is SO amazing. Full this with soapy water and boom you can clean your dogs feet with no hassle. Even my dog with sensitive feet doesn’t mind this. It’s a great quality product for the price as well! I love it. I use this during bath time or even if their feet get muddy from the backyard when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Russell

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised at how well these worked, but they're great! We take them with us when we take the dogs out on trails. The lids don't have a way of screwing closed to keep fluid in, so when we're on the move we put soapy water in a separate jug. The only thing I'd change is if they could come with two lids--the one with the opening and one that was solid to make it water-tight for travel. But clearly you can work around that ;-) I find these absolutely indispensable for helping keep my tiny, carpeted apartment clean.
customer_reviews.author: BreccaCo

customer_reviews.title: Great for muddy doggies
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepherd loves to play outside. After two weeks of rain, our backyard turned to mud, as did our kitchen floor every time the dog came inside. This Paw cleaner is amazing. Add a drop of doggie shampoo if you like (we need to occasionally), and you get those puppy paws nice and clean! This also works great if you have a dog that just needs his paws washed, and washed well. Whoever came up with this idea is a genius!
customer_reviews.author: R. Giordano

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This item does not work well for small dogs, or maybe I did not utilize it for its intended purpose. We recently moved into the city and our white dogs paws are GREY when we come in From walking (concrete & pea gravel everywhere). The instructions tell you to simply add water. Needless to say, the combo of rubber bristles and water didnt do much for their paws. Perhaps if they actually had MUD on them it would have done a better job? For me and my dogs’ purpose, it was a waste of time and energy and we will be sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE this❣️❣️
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 Papillons. All 3 have different preferences where they cautiously step. But at the end of the day this is a SAVIOR! My 2 older ones love the massage they get. Let them stand in it while you gently turn the cup. The inside is so soft, I see why they like it. Absolutely clean paws every night! It’s a little taller than expected for a small (6lb)I Papi. I suggest half the size of the small one. I will buy and to be safe I’ll order a few Incase they sell out. I’ll post pictures in an update.
customer_reviews.author: Fit4life

customer_reviews.title: Pretty genius. Gets that mud from under the nails too!
customer_reviews.text: This was our pup’s Christmas present. We have a bird dog who loves to run the fence line and play with the next door dogs. This means, after TX rain, his path is a muddy mess. Which means, when he comes in the doggy door, my carpet becomes one too. Although it still takes effort and you to be attentive, this is a great alternative to the hose and your hand. I can control the water temperature and then just dry his paws with a towel afterwards. To get the mud from under his nails take a little bit, but it’s still quick and painless. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Mendez

customer_reviews.title: The largest size is very difficult for anyone with smaller hands to use.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this, but having a 90 pound German shepherd with large paws, I had to get the largest size. Although it works great when my dog is behaving or someone is holding onto him for me so i can dip his paws. It is almost impossible for me to use by myself. If I had a smaller dog and could use the smaller size I am sure it would would have given it a better review. I ended up just going back to my "water in a bucket" method. My husband has no problem using this and really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn F.

customer_reviews.title: i love this thing, and my pup doesnt mind it at all!
customer_reviews.text: makes his paw cleanings super easy!! i do tend to spill the water in the cup pretty often, so i said 4 stars for ease of use only because spills will probably happen when you use it. but i just lay a towel down before i use it, and then use whatever dry parts of the towel to dab off my pups paws, so it works out perfectly for me either way. and the bristles really do work! i just dunk my pups paws in like two or three times and when i pour the water out its completely black and muddy and with grass bits in it.
customer_reviews.author: B-Berry

customer_reviews.title: No more filthy paws!
customer_reviews.text: Our pup loves to pad around in spring mud and dig trenches in the backyard. We always had a tough time trying to get the clods of mud out from under his nails and between his paw pads before he tracked up the house. The MudBuster is elegantly simple and works every time. Fill it up with water, dunk his paws up and down into it and the many flexible silicone filaments gently clean underneath the nails, under and between the paw pads. Then you just dump out the dirty water outside when you're done. The silicone mat inside can be removed, hosed off and left to dry when it gets messy. Wish we had gotten this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not magic either. But good to have in a pinch.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad and I’m happy I have it but not magic. This makes a mess. And if your dog sticks a muddy paw in, you need to change the water before you do the next paw and probably several times before you move on to the other 3 paws. However, when you don’t want to do a full bath, this helps the bath come to you. Which I appreciate. It’s far from perfect or simple. But it is helpful. Honestly though, you’d get the same effect with a wet soapy towel and a dry towel afterward. If not better. I dunno. Probably not as effective as you’d think.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Hard to hold with small hands
customer_reviews.text: I got a large size as we have Rottweilers and it was a good fit for them. However, I have small hands and had a difficult time holding the container while inserting their feet. Because of that, I wasn't able to wash their feet well enough to get the dirt off. I took the insert out to clean it and had a really difficult time getting it back inside. I ended up giving it to my daughter to use with her dogs and haven't gotten any feedback from her. I'm assuming that it would work easier with her larger hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy G.

customer_reviews.title: Just as Described but Doesn't Save Time
customer_reviews.text: This product does its job and definitely removes dirt from my dog's paws when they come inside from the backyard. Unfortunately, it's just not as quick as I would like. I have to fill it with water, clean and dry 8 paws and rinse the tube. I wanted something super quick since I let them out and back in 5+ times a day. I don't think this is any quicker and efficient than spraying their paws with the hose real quick. You will need to dry their paws off right after use. It's certainly still better for the environment than always using paw wipes. If you have just one dog it may be better.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, just as advertised.get bigger than you think you need though
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly like the pictures, high quality, durable. We have a 75lb pit mix and got the Medium. I wouldve probably liked a bigger one only because its taller and our dog gets mud under his nails pretty good. The med is fine but i will probably order another one bc 2 paws muddies the water up too much to clean all 4 paws. It's easy to take apart, rinse, and assemble again each time our dog goes outside which is nice. I hand wash it each night. I'm really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t Work Good At All For Us! Major Messy
customer_reviews.text: Finally had our first rain in Central Texas in a while. Used this last night on our Golden Retriever, made more of a mess than if we had just wiped his paws off! Spilled water out, semi freakish to our dog and he’s very good at allowing his feet to be cleaned after coming inside. This product sounded like a good idea and definitely was not for us. I’m sad it didn’t work like we had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: J. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: The MudBuster is worth its weight in gold! My dog frequently comes in from outside with muddy paws. She hates when I have to dip her paws in a bucket to clean the mud. The MudBuster is easy to use, non-traumatic for my dog and easy to keep clean! My dog willingly gives me her paws to dip in the MudBuster! All you do is fill with water put the dog's paws, one by one in the MudBuster (move the paw up and down in the MudBuster), and dry the paws. The MudBuster easily comes apart for cleaning after each use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to muddy paws in the house
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT solution to my 2 dogs dragging dirt and mud into the house. I was using a towel... no good, then I started using a bucket of water to wash their paws each time... worked, but a lot of hassle. Then I heard about this from a radio personality one day in a side comment about silly things she has bought online and I searched for it. This takes the hassle out of the whole bucket full of water, and then makes it portable as well. Just make sure to squeeze the paws a little to get off the excess water before towel drying them and this thing is a breeze. Recommending!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders on thick, long coats.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works! I purchased the LARGE for my old English sheepdog. He’s very finicky about his paws and was a little difficult to get him to insert his paw but once he did, it seemed like it was therapeutic for him. My olde English sheepdog, who’s usually disinterested in everything even came over and wanted his paws washed next! I was able to do a shampoo, condition, and rinse both dogs easily and in a matter of minutes. I was particularly excited for the results on my OES. His double coat is difficult to clean and brush. Not only were his paws clean, they were left relatively untangled.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of A Shopper

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn’t buy this after reading a couple of the reviews, but I am glad I did. I love this thing! We have a 4-month-old Westie puppy, white, and 1.5 acres of land with a tilled garden. She loves to dig and I was having to bathe her in the sink 2-3 times a day to clean her feet. This works perfectly. I set it on the ground, put a paw in, swish around, take it out and dry off, next paw. She doesn’t mind it at all and in fact tries to drink the water out of it. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "They" said we would use it, but "they" were wrong
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a last minute all-on. We had a pup on the way and wanted to have all of the accessories. People told us that they bought this but never used it. We use ours all of the time!! We have a digger and a backyard with lots of landscaping so dirty paws are a continued occurrence. This is WAY better then a full wash or trying to just wash their paws in the sink or wherever. Its amazing how much dirt it cleans off too, especially with a fluffy dog.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for dogs with very hairy paws!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dogs and wipe their paws before I bring them in from their walks to minimize dirt and germs. This product works great for my 110lb wolf hybrid that has very hairy paws underneath. I dip his feet and then dry with a rag. No more mud everywhere that just wiping was missing.
customer_reviews.author: Carey Schreier

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found this unit
customer_reviews.text: Glad I found this unit. Dogs didn't want to cooperate at first, but got used to it in time and are fine with it now. When they come in with muddy feet, I dip up and down 3-4 times and then wipe with a towel. I would say that when feet are black with mud this unit gets off about 60-70% of the dirt on the first pass. Sometimes I empty and refill with fresh water and do each foot again. After that a damp towel can remove the remaining dirt. Really helps on those rainy days when the backyard is muddy.
customer_reviews.author: kokode

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky and it did not clean properly.
customer_reviews.text: What I disliked about this product was the cup was so large it was extremely hard to hold. It did take some of the dirt off the paws but not all of it! When I dried his feet with the towel the towel was dirty. I tried it many times and paws were still dirty so I return this item. The thing that was nice about the item was it didn’t get water all over the place. It should have a handle on it though so you can hold it.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma of pit bull.

customer_reviews.title: clean paws!
customer_reviews.text: Our 1 year old golden retriever loves to play and dig in the mud. During the winter the outside hose bibs are turned off so I tried this paw cleaner. Just fill it with to near the top with warm water, insert one paw at a time and move the cleaner up and down and slightly rotating it at the same time. Voila! Clean paws. And the warm water feels good on those cold paws. The "fingers" are soft and do not hurt those tender puppy paws. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: VitaminB6

customer_reviews.title: Huge Help!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one after the rescue we foster through recommended this product. We have a 75 lb Boxer and ordered the large one. Perfect fit for our big guy. We've had a lot of rain the last couple of weeks and we're constantly having to clean off his and our foster pup's paws, which takes forever, prior to getting the MudBuster. This worked like a charm, just have a towel ready to dry off their paws. I haven't had to use my carpet cleaner to clean up dirty paw prints nor hurt my back from bending over to scrub all the mud from their paws. I'm so glad I got bought this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole McGinnis

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: I have two big dogs and live in an apartment. I do have wood floor, so it isn't SO bad if they come in with dirty/muddy feet. However, it's a lot of work to mop and use towels, then wash those, etc. With this paw cleaner it makes everything SO much easier. I am able to fill it up with water, dip their feet in, and dry their paws off. It's SUPER easy to clean. Only thing I would say is that I didn't pay attention to the measurements for the sizes and I got a large. It is HUGE. I could have definitely just gotten a medium and been more than fine.
customer_reviews.author: Maegan Harless

customer_reviews.title: BEST PAW CLEANERS ON THE MARKET!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the small, medium and large sizes and LOVE them all, I have a lot of dogs and they love to run outside, it has been raining lately and finally I got a chance to use them, let me tell you, they all work wonderfully, all of my dogs paws were very muddy with grass and stuff stuck to them, perfect time to try these paw cleaners, I just added warm water and they love it, they didn't even flinch when I cleaned their paws, the cleaners are soft and gentle and get their paws super clean, I recommend this to all my friends that have puppies, THE BEST!!!!
customer_reviews.author: PMTZ

customer_reviews.title: A wet dish towel is less messy.
customer_reviews.text: I have a black lab in the hot Texas sun who loves nothing more than mud puddles! Rainy days are her favorite and she loves the hose and her puppy pool, and digging. So, MUD. I thought, this will be great. And perhaps if I were a better trainer and could reign in here puppiness so that she wasn't bouncing off the walls after frolicking, this would have been better, but I find that using a wet tea towel works faster and easier than trying to get her paw in the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Timms

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It was okay, I like the idea of this item, but for me it seems the bristles on the inside aren’t firm enough to clean in between my dogs pads and nails, what actually ended up happening was the dirt in the nails ended up getting wet and creating more of a muddy mess. I had to continue to use a cloth to clean their paws even after using this product which deafrated the purpose. May work for some dogs. But not for mine
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Weber

customer_reviews.title: Life changing, especially for my white kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I will always recommend this. I have a double coated English springer spaniel which I let run in my yard. Before this, I would use a towel to clean her and my white kitchen tails would look terrible after that. Now I just use this device and it works wonders. She is 40 pounds and has pretty big paws and this fits great. However, I would recommend putting some shampoo in it with the water and then using a towel to dry the paws. That way it really gets off all the dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Vanesa

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: I have average size (female) hands. Bought for our Golden Retrievers - the bottle is rather large and hard to maneuver when using one hand on the dog & one hand on the container. Also challenging to get the inside removed to clean it. Aside from that, it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Keepnitclassy

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you have a dog.
customer_reviews.text: This works great on my standard poodle. I fill it with warm soapy water and she actually seems to enjoy getting her feet washed, even when they are not muddy. It keeps her from tracking dirt and germs all over our house. She's a service dog too so she goes a lot of places. When you pour the water out, I do take the lid off first as water traps in the rim/lid and will drip out otherwise. The inside is soft and easily slides out of the cup to clean it as well. All and all, so worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Paul & Jaime Revel

customer_reviews.title: Wet paws not clean paws
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea but it simply does not work. It only thing it does is leave your pet with extremely wet paws. I purchased Medium based upon the size of my pets paws and the size chart. This thing is huge, I could wash my pets entire leg (75lb Catahoula/Cur) in this thing. It’s so large that the bristles do not reach into the pets paws to clean. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora Cosmos

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about these products. My husband wanted to get one for the longest time and finally I gave in because I was tired of picking up our 70 lb boxer and carrying her to the tub through the house. IT WORKS. ITS SO HANDY. WORTH EVERY PENNY. I keep it by the door and use it when she comes in and then I dump it out and fill it right back up and put it back by the door for the next potty break. BUY THIS YALL ITS WORTH IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Davis

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST PRODUCT EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Medium and Large MudBuster for my large labradoodle.. I should’ve listened to one of the reviewer about the Large size MudBuster, that it wasn’t necessary to buy because the Medium size works perfectly and I agree with that. It cleans my labradoodle paws great! I love it!! No more wiping with baby wipes. Hehehe. I definitely don’t regret purchasing both, one day the Large MudBuster will come-in-handy!! 👍👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: thehills

customer_reviews.title: Works! But tangles long paw fur
customer_reviews.text: I have a 13 pound poodle mix and was sure the small size was too big for his little paws. I tested it out last night after a very rainy/muddy walk and it worked like magic! Just two dips and his white fur and paws came out clean! It takes some practice (if you have an impatient dog) and made a big mess, but I'm so shocked how good this worked on such a small dog! The only down side is it tangles my doodle's long hair A LOT. He needed a thorough paw brush after, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: SharonT13

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great product for messy paws. I ordered a large. Might be difficult for someone with small hands to try to do by themselves. Our dogs handled well. I recommend putting a towel under to catch the drips when removing the paw. The bristles are very flexible. This was very easy to use and clean. Very happy that it’s dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Laura T.

customer_reviews.title: Literal couch and carpet saver
customer_reviews.text: Our pup loves to dig in the dirt and even wiping her paws with towels did not do the trick. This paw cleaner is a lifesaver, super easy to use, doesn't bother my pup at all, she knows to wait by the door for me to get this device and she offers paws to clean. Super easy to just add water (we use a drop of dog shampoo in there but you don't need to), and you can rinse off with water, no mystery to this device. I love it and recommend it to everyone I know!!
customer_reviews.author: Clara Bruno Graham

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy paw cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have two pit bulls and they both have they same problem... they won’t stop licking their paws. We’ve tried all types of soaps, lotions and though they do help, we just couldn’t deep clean their paws. This product has saved us so much time because it’s so easy to use. Our dogs still don’t like us cleaning their paws but it does make it a lot easier and they don’t lick their paws as much. Great to have if you go to the park and your dog find mud like ours always do. It’s easy to clean their paws with this. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Gamboa

customer_reviews.title: Too Large to Hold and Didn't Clean Paws
customer_reviews.text: I got the large for my German Shepherd. First of all, it was too big to comfortably fit in my hand, making it hard to maneuver. Secondly, and perhaps due to the unwieldy size, it didn't actually clean my dog's paws. She'd still track dirt throughout the house after I'd "clean" her paws with this. Also, because there's no cover, water can easily spill from the container.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in an attempt to keep my house less of a mess and am consistently pleased with how much dirt it gets off the dog. Bought the medium size for a 70+ lb supermutt/pyrenees/shepherd (trying to give a size estimate!) and it fits well enough - is actually quite large and I imagine the bigger size would be more clumsy to handle. As is, the medium is very easy to use and the bristles are gentle enough that they get the job done but the dog doesn't seem to mind. Excellent purchase, would recommend. Would also recommend a microfibre towel or similar to dry off after the wash!
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Depends on the dog
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs: Dog A doesn't mind using this at all and it does a good job of getting the mud and dirt off. Just make sure you have a towel ready because even if you dog comes in just dirty he will be wet and probably muddy after using this. Dog B is convinced this is a torture device.
customer_reviews.author: jpl

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t worth buying
customer_reviews.text: The product functions perfectly, giving it 2 stars because I feel silly for buying it. Basically the same as dunking my dogs paws in a bowl of water to clean them. The water gets dirty instantly so unless your dog will stay in one spot while you change out the water you are going to have a super wet mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this for muddy paws
customer_reviews.text: Just a bit of warm water and this makes cleaning up our dogs paws so much easeier when they come in all muddy. We say paw check and they stand still and let us dip their paws in one by one and then wipe it with a towel and off they go. No more muddy paw prints on the floor or trying to keep them still for 10 minutes to wipe them with a wet paper towel over and over to get all the mud off. Worth every penny, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nodak

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6mo old black lab who gets a lot of dirt packed into those giant paws at the dog park. I fill it with warm sudsy water and it takes three seconds per paw to get very clean. My puppy had no problem with me using it on him, but he is very good with me handling his paws. I ordered the Large (he's 6mo & 50lbs), and it fits fine, but he'll grow into it. The lining comes out for easy cleaning, and if you have trouble getting it back in, flip it upside down (I made that mistake the first time until I realized one side was bigger in diameter than the other).
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: A little gimmicky but ok
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100lb beast who gets filthy every time he goes out. I have a set of boots for him but I only really put them on when its nasty out (rains or right after it rains). Occasionally he finds himself running in dirt or digging at something so I wanted something I can have because my hose is not near my back door. This definitely fits that need for me but he has stepped in his own poop and this really didn't clean his paws enough. For dirt it did the trick but for anything messier I'm afraid this falls a little short. I'm ok with it and will use it when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D. Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! Our house had construction which left a mud pit in the back yard. Every time our dog came inside her paws were filthy and tracked mud in. We started cleaning her own with this every time and it works great. She got used to it after the 4th or 5th time using it and now it’s a breeze. Very easy to take a part to clean it in the dishwasher. Would definitely recommend this if your pup has dirty paws after being outside.
customer_reviews.author: CES

customer_reviews.title: Works surprisingly well!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on 2 pitbulls. One weighs 80 lbs, one 55 lbs. Paws fit inside nicely without a struggle, and cleaned them very well. I'd say it was a success. Saves me from having a dirty/wet towel by the door to wipe paws with every time they come in from outdoors with muddy paws. My only advice is once you use it and empty it, take the silicone scrubber out to let the cup dry otherwise moisture gets stuck between the silicone and the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on my Spaniel; when his fur grows out, his fluffy feet hold so much dirt and mud that it makes going outside in the rain a real chore! So this was supposed to help clean him up, but it really only makes him uncomfortable and swishes his paw around in muddy water. There isn't an easy way to hold this big cup if you have small hands, this one is like griping a 32 oz souvenir cup. His paws don'e really get clean at all :(
customer_reviews.author: VirgoDink

customer_reviews.title: Gets the paw cleaning job done nicely!
customer_reviews.text: In the winter time when our outside hose is not an option this cleaner is perfect! I bought the medium for my 60lb dog and it is the right size. My cream golden doodle is not crazy about her paws being touched and so I was pleasantly surprised when I picked up her paw, inserted and rotated (still working on that part!) and she stood quietly! It really does work well getting the dirt out and also is perfect for rinsing away the winter road salt and chemicals. It takes very little time, has practically no mess and is easy to clean after. And it makes a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: CFM

customer_reviews.title: Muddy paw solution!
customer_reviews.text: I have battled my English Cream’s big muddy paws for 4 years. I dread the rainy days and I live in Oregon so there are a lot of them. I decided to give this a try. Just used it and I LOVE it!!!!! It was gentle and all the dirt actually came off. Gave them a little pat to get off the extra water and he was ready to be back in the house. For the English Cream I used a large. I also ordered a small for my mini poodle. I haven’t used that one yet but I assume it’s just as great!
customer_reviews.author: Salvador Jane

customer_reviews.title: Gets really clean paws, no waste from wipes.
customer_reviews.text: If you make ur dog wipe their paws before coming inside. This is the product for you and it pays itself off. Instead of buying wasteful paw wipes and wiping my dogs paws I’ll put a little bit of puppy shampoo and water and wipe his paws off with a towel. He doesn’t mind it at all so The bristles are soft and don’t bother him. If u had multiple dogs or if ur dog goes out multiple times before actually doing their business this item is much more effective than paw wipes
customer_reviews.author: DeJia

customer_reviews.title: If you have a dog, you NEED one!
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly cleans paws, nails, and lower legs very quickly and with ease. A HUGE plus is that my dog doesn’t fight me over it, she knows to stick her paw in and it’ll be over in no time (this is a dog that runs and hides when the drawer with her nail clippers is even opened). The MudBuster is also easily taken apart to rinse clean and dry out, dishwasher safe for sanitary cleaning. I’ve been telling everyone I know with a dog to get one.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Mardorf

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended to use inside, as you have to fill it up pretty full depending on amount of mud on your dog. Water typically gets on the floor, but it does a great job cleaning the paw. My dog loves the mud (white golden doodle), so I do a "rough clean" of all 4, then go in for the "final rinse" with fresh water.
customer_reviews.author: Ciara Baker

customer_reviews.title: Keeps her paws clean and my house too
customer_reviews.text: My husband said this is the best things I have bought so far. Easy to use, easy to clean. Our dog doesnt like to play with water but mud is something else, digging, rolling . You name it, she got it. She doesnt like hose, tap shower , nothing but let us use this mudbuster so quietly , easily, no fight. Put water inside, pop her paws inside , done. This mudbuster is life savior. We alwayz keep it by the door and use it almost everyday, sometime 3 to 4 times day. Keeps her paws clean , n my house too.
customer_reviews.author: Emerald

product_meta.title: Dexas MudBuster Portable Dog Paw Washer/ Paw Cleaner
product_meta.description: Color:Blue| Size:MediumThe Dexas MudBuster is a new, innovative and easy way to rinse your dog’s dirty or muddy paws, before they track it all over the house! Using the MudBuster is easy: muddy paws go in, clean paws come out! To use, add a little water to the base of the Mud Buster. Then, insert the muddy paw, do the twist, dab the paw dry, and repeat for 3 more feet! The Mud Buster features an array of soft, gentle, thick silicone bristles inside an easy-to-grip tumbler. Designed to be gentle on your dog's paw, the silicone bristles will gently loosen mud and dirt, keeping the mess in the MudBuster and not in your home or car. The Mud Buster is great for trips to the park, hiking, running or even playing outside. The Medium MudBuster is specially sized for medium to large sized breeds. BPA free! In addition to grooming tools, Dexas carries a large assortment of Petware including the popular Popware for Pets collection. The MudBuster is a patented product: Patent No. D799,126, US and Foreign Patents Pending. Breeds include Australian Shepherd, Beagle, Border Collie, Boxer, Corgi, English Bulldog and many Terriers.
feature_bullets: The medium MudBuster is perfectly sized for medium sized dogs: it measures 6 inches tall and 4 inches wide
To use, add a little water, insert the muddy paw, do the twist, dab the paw dry, repeat for 3 more paws
The gentle silicone bristles will help remove dirt and mud from your dog's paws- keeping the mess in the MudBuster and not in your house
Keep the MudBuster handy after trips to the park, after walks or hikes, or by your backdoor
Simple and easy to use, just rinse and keep on hand for next muddy encounter. BPA free
Patent No. D799,126, US and Foreign Patents Pending

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
